description: This Python source file provides utility functions for interacting with a SQLite database, including schema setup, connection handling, querying, and executing commands. It is part of a backend system managing users, jobs, and progress data, with schema creation and data access functions.

methods.name: None _ensure_schema(conn: sqlite3.Connection)
methods.description: Creates tables 'users', 'jobs', and 'progress' if they do not exist.

methods.name: get_conn()
methods.description: Context manager that provides a SQLite connection with schema ensured, and closes it after use.

methods.name: list[dict[str,Any]] fetch_all(conn: sqlite3.Connection, query: str, params: Iterable[Any])
methods.description: Executes a query to fetch multiple rows and returns them as a list of dictionaries.

methods.name: Optional[dict[str,Any]] fetch_one(conn: sqlite3.Connection, query: str, params: Iterable[Any])
methods.description: Executes a query to fetch a single row and returns it as a dictionary, or None if no row is found.

methods.name: None execute(conn: sqlite3.Connection, query: str, params: Iterable[Any])
methods.description: Executes a SQL command (insert, update, delete) and commits the transaction.

ctags.name: execute
ctags.pattern: /^def execute(conn: sqlite3.Connection, query: str, params: Iterable[Any]) -> None:$/

ctags.name: fetch_all
ctags.pattern: /^def fetch_all(conn: sqlite3.Connection, query: str, params: Iterable[Any]) -> list[dict[str, Any/

ctags.name: fetch_one
ctags.pattern: /^def fetch_one(conn: sqlite3.Connection, query: str, params: Iterable[Any]) -> Optional[dict[str,/
